availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Bradshaw (Powell County, Kentucky, brickmaker, sheriff, and soldier.)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky, brickmaker, sheriff, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Mary T. Dugan Bradshaw. Father of Caroline Bradshaw, Mary Jane Bradshaw, James Bradshaw, Clinton Bradshaw, Martha A. Bradshaw, and Louisa Bradshaw. Brickmason in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Brickmaker in Powell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Sheriff in Powell County in 1861. Served in the 2nd Battalion Kentucky Mounted Rifles (C.S.A.) as a captain from September 14, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 64A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 54.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Paris Precinct, p. 390B.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0020.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994053, Powell County Births.
“Obituary,” The Bourbon News (Paris, KY), September 23, 1893, p. 5.
"John H. Bradshaw (1827-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial 130056001, accessed March 20, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/130056001.
